- Title: The Shawshank Redemption  (1994) ) | Plot: Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a man who has spent many years in prison for the murder of his wife and her lover, escapes from Shawshank State Penitentiary (SPP) after spending nearly two decades inside its walls. However, after several days, they are forced to leave the woods due to their growing hunger. After returning to SPP, Andy soon becomes a respected member of the prison community. However, Andy's past continues to haunt him. In particular, Andy is constantly reminded of his wife's murder and his lover's involvement in it. As a result, Andy finds himself struggling with feelings of guilt, remorse, and despair over the terrible things that have happened to him in the past.

Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend 'Rushmore'.
This movie tells the story of three childhood friends who reunite after many years as adults living in different parts of New York State.
The three main characters are:
- Chris Rock (played by Chris Rock) - a charismatic and intelligent man who is often underestimated but always proves his worth through his actions and words.
- Ralph Fioretti (played by Richard Dreyfuss) - an older man who is often underestimated but always proves his worth through his actions and words.
- Ben Hecht (played by Ben Hecht) - a younger man who is often underestimated but always proves his worth through his actions and words.
The movie Rushmore is not just a comedy, it is also a story of friendship and loyalty.
